match_data.recommendation: Strong match for an urgent burst pipe in San Francisco. The worker’s skills, availability (including weekends), and past performance fit the gig well. Confirm active plumbing license and align on emergency call-out pricing and materials. If license is verified and budget expectations are aligned, proceed.
key_insights: Meets 2 of 3 stated requirements (Emergency response, Weekend availability); license verification pending
5 years of experience and pipe installation background suit burst pipe repairs
High completion count and 4.8 rating suggest reliability under time pressure
Preferred areas include San Francisco, minimizing travel time for an emergency
Available now, aligning with the gig’s urgency

response.title: E-commerce website for clothing store
response.description: I need a website developer to build a modern e-commerce website for my clothing store. I need it done in 3 weeks and my budget is around $1500.

response.title: Urgent kitchen sink leak repair today 5 PM
response.description: I need a plumber today at 5 PM to fix a leak in my kitchen sink. It's urgent.

response.explanation: Building a modern e-commerce site with secure payment integration typically requires a mid-to-senior developer or small team. At ~3 weeks (about 120 hours), global market rates of $45–$75/hr place a fair budget between $4.5k and $9k; normal urgency and remote work keep pricing moderate. The $7k recommendation balances quality (checkout, gateway integration, responsive UI, basic admin) without overpaying for a fully custom platform.

Urgent on-site plumbing in downtown Chicago commands a premium due to licensed trade rates, travel/parking, and same-day response. This range covers a service call plus 1–2 hours of labor and basic parts; after-hours or faucet/pipe replacement would trend toward the upper end.

With normal urgency and a remote setup, global market rates apply. Assuming a mid-skill, moderate-scope project requiring ~20–50 hours at $50–$80/hr, a fair range is $1,200–$4,000 with no rush premium. Remote competition moderates the top end, while protecting for professional quality sets a reasonable floor.
